tutorial.title: Adding Events With Methods
tutorial.descriptionContent: Use methods to add events to elements.

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent:
Let's learn about a newer way of adding events to elements that let us add multiple event handlers to the same event.

Press the buttons to toggle different height and width values.

lessons.title: Add event
lessons.interactiveContent:
A more modern way of adding events to elements is with the addEventListener() method.

Use this method to add the click event and then tap on the element.

Make sure to pick addEventListener.

lessons.title: Parentheses
lessons.interactiveContent:
Once we've added the method, we add the name of the event we want to listen for, followed by a comma and the function we want to call.

Make sure to pick "click", followed by ,, and finally changeColor.

lessons.title: Event names
lessons.interactiveContent:
When using methods to add or remove events, we use the event names and not the property names. Instead of onclick, we write click.

Make sure to type click.

lessons.title: Remove
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can also remove events with the removeEventListener() method.

Remove the event listener after toggling the color. Tap the div to change the color, and then tap it again. The color remains pink.

Make sure to pick removeEventListener.

lessons.title: Remove II
lessons.interactiveContent:
Removing event listeners comes in handy if we only want an event to happen once.

To make the element change color only once, we can remove the click event from inside the changeColor() event handler.

Make sure to pick removeEventListener, followed by addEventListener.

lessons.title: Multiple events
lessons.interactiveContent:
Adding events with the help of methods can come in handy if we want to add multiple event handlers to the same event trigger.

Although we have three buttons below, we're actually only using two event handlers.

lessons.title: Multiple events II
lessons.interactiveContent:
If we want an element to have multiple event handlers for the same element, we can add them one by one with the addEventListener() method.

Make sure to pick addEventListener followed by click and then addEventListener, click.

lessons.title: Question: Parentheses
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does addEventListener() do?

It defines what event handler is called when an event is triggered on an elementIt defines what event is called when an event handler is triggered on an element

It defines what event handler is called when an event is triggered on an element.

lessons.title: Question: Add event
lessons.interactiveContent:
What do we add inside the addEventListener() method?

The name of the event followed by the event handler nameThe HTML event attribute

The name of the event followed by the event handler name.

Make sure to pick dblclick.

lessons.title: Question: Remove
lessons.interactiveContent:
In which case would we remove an event?

When we want an event to only happen a set number of timesWe remove it every time after we trigger it and set it again afterwards

When we want an event to only happen a set number of times.
